alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 5:09PM EDT until July 18 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Franklin County in western Maine... East Central Oxford County in western Maine... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Farmington, Rumford, Jay, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, Canton, Wilton, Mexico, Livermore and Chesterville. This includes the following Rec locations... Mount Zircon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
